channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MN

item.title: Report X-2023121122
item.description:
Report X-2023121122

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-04T15:11:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-14
  • City: MINNEAPOLIS
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PACKAGE WAS BROUGHT TO THE DMP, BY THE RESPONDER FROM THE OUTBOUND WALL. IN THE DMP, PACKAGE WAS OPENED AND FOUND TO CONTAIN ONE, 1 GALLON, PLASTIC BOTTLE OF LIQUICLEAN MCT113, BEING SHIPPED AS A CORROSIVE HAZ-MAT SHIPPMENT, (UN3265, CORROSIVE LIQUID, ACIDIC, ORGANIC, N.O.S.,(FORMIC ACID, HYDROXYACETIC ACID), 8, II, 1 FIBERBOARD BOX 1 GALLON). THE CAP ON THE GALLON JUG WAS LOOSE, WHICH ALLOWED A LARGE PORTION OF THE ACID TO ESCAPE ON THE FLOOR, NEAR THE LOCATION OF THE TRUCK. ALL ACID WAS ABSORBED AND PROCESSED THROUGH THE DMP ACCORDING TO REGULATIONS.

item.title: Report E-2023120448
item.description:
Report E-2023120448

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-02T15:11:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-04
  • City: FRIDLEY
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 5 gallons of Imron 2.8 Poyeurathane (UN1263) was released from a 5-gallon metal pail due to a forklift puncture. The SDS was reviewed with the terminal and they felt comfortable cleaning up the release with PPE available on-site. 1- 30-gallon DM containing one 5-gallon metal pail of Imron 2.8 Motor oil and oil dri was created as waste and left onsite for the terminal to manage.

item.title: Report X-2023121022
item.description:
Report X-2023121022

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-30T17:46:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-07
  • City: MAPLE GROVE
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: HAZMAT AUDITOR STOPPED AT THE DMP CAGE AND SAID ONE OF THE PACKAGES ON HIS ELECTRIC TRAM SEEMED TO BE GIVING OF A STRONG CHEMICAL ODOR AND POINTED TO A PACKAGE WITH BOTH CLASS 5.1 AND 8 HAZARD DIAMONDS. OPENING AND INSPECTING THE INDICATED PACKAGE, RESPONDER FOUND 4 1GAL CONTAINERS WITH VENTED CAPS AND 2 HAD SOME LIQUID LEAK FROM THE VENT HOLE AND STAINED THE INNER CARDBOARD

item.title: Report X-2023120976
item.description:
Report X-2023120976

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-30T17:46:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-18
  • City: ROGERS
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: someone suspected that the package might be damaged due to the alcoholic smell coming from it. upon confirming that it had leaked, they placed it in a lined tote, brought it to the damage area, and moved it to the drain mats in the incoming damaged hazmat/LQ area. in-house cleanup, awaiting disposition. DescribePack: one bottle leaked due to loose cap DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: placed in lined tote, moved to drain mats

item.title: Report X-2023120531
item.description:
Report X-2023120531

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-30T17:46:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-30
  • City: MINNEAPOLIS
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PACKAGE WAS TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP BY THE RESPONDER, FROM THE UNLOAD. IN THE DMP PACKAGE WAS OPENED AND FOUND TO CONTAIN FOUR PLASTIC CONTAINERS OF MINNCARE HD DISINFECTANT, BEING SHIPPED AS A OXIDIZER/CORROSIVE HAZ-MAT SHIPMENT (UN3149, HYDROGEN PEROXIDE AND PEROXYACETIC ACID MIXTURES, STABILIZED, 5.1(8), 1 FIBERBOARD BOX X 4 GALLON). THE CAP ON ONE OF THE 4 JUGS WAS LOOSE ALLOWING A SMALL AMOUNT OF THE OXIDIZER/ CORROSIVE TO ESCAPE. ALL MATERIAL WAS PROCESSED THROUGH THE DMP ACCORDING TO REGULATIONS.
